basics.name: Bram van Berkel
basics.label: Back-end Developer
basics.summary: Backend PHP developer with 5 years of experience in designing and implementing web applications. Skilled in PHP, Laravel, Javascript and Typescript, SQL and a little bit of Go. Passionate about staying current with industry trends.

work.name: MyWheels
work.summary: At MyWheels I worked in the Book-and-Pay team, where we were responsible for (among others): searching for an available car, making a reservation, and paying afterwards. The app is built using React Native and Expo, and the api serving the app using JSON-RPC.
highlights: Collaborate with the frontenders to fix issues and implement new features, and do a little bit of app development when possible
Helped with the migration to a new PSP, to think out a new architecture for the new payment and invoicing system

work.name: HoorayHR
work.description: HoorayHR is the all-in-one HR platform for entrepreneurs. Streamline your HR tasks in one simple environment.
work.summary: At Hooray I worked with the team to deliver new features and support our Customer Success team
highlights: Work with the development team on the back-end of the application, using Node, Typescript and FeathersJS
Implemented advanced monitoring, allowing us to keep an eye on things like load, requests and stability

work.name: DIJ
work.summary: As a Backend Developer at DIJ, we worked for various clients, ranging from car rental companies to pharmacies.
highlights: Maintained existing platforms and helped shape the foundation of new applications

work.name: Solvari
work.description: Find and compare specialists to enhance your home.
work.summary: Solvari is a platform that helps homeowners find the right professional for their job. Be it the installation of solar panels or adding insulation.
highlights: Worked with the Product owner and UX designers on the B2B side of Solvari
Responsible for the API connections with the systems of our professionals

work.name: Luminext
work.description: Luminext smart lighting systems to control public lighting. Dim the street lighting and only illuminate when neede. Save energy and costs.

references.name: Sem Bogaarts (https://github.com/sembogaarts)
references.reference: Bram is a dynamic team player who fully commits and has an instinct for the right course. His contribution is an asset to any team!

projects.name: MuntBook
projects.description: A blockchain explorer for the dutch "Munt" coin, previously "Gulden". Built together with the community
highlights: Built using Laravel, AlpineJS, TailwindUI, Postgres and hosted via Forge
Dashboards to monitor the health of the blockchain
Featured on CoinMarketCap as Chain explorer for Munt

projects.name: Testnummers.dev
projects.description: A site for developers to quickly generate or validate test numbers. Still in use at previous and current employers
highlights: Built using Vite, Vue, Typescript and Tailwind
